definition: to give up/to admit failure/to drop the matter/to reconcile oneself to loss/to have no more illusions about
to be hell-bent on/dead set on sth/unswerving
see 死心塌地[si3 xin1 ta1 di4]

sentences.english: How to just want to consult with Luan school let Yao Zhenzhen be dead.
sentences.chinese: 自己来只是想和栾学堂商量怎么让姚珍珍死心。

sentences.english: Mom wants Wang Xiaozao to give up, insist on.
sentences.chinese: 吴妈想让王小早死心，坚持住下去。

sentences.english: Then they will always be loyal to him.
sentences.chinese: 然后他们就总会死心塌地的效忠于他了。

sentences.english: But she did not give it up regardless.
sentences.chinese: 但无论如何她还是不死心。

sentences.english: Faith deadens a mans heart to the things of this world .
sentences.chinese: 信心让人对这世界的东西死心。

sentences.english: Made a Mo for a while, really some deathless hearts.
sentences.chinese: 弄墨顿了一下，实在有些不死心。

sentences.english: These mutual assurances hardened us in the thing.
sentences.chinese: 这种互相的保证使我们死心塌地地干去。

sentences.english: But determined criminals are still managing to find other ways to steal cars.
sentences.chinese: 但是不死心的盗贼们却还在一直想方设法偷车。

sentences.english: Find a worthy hell-bent person, love.
sentences.chinese: 找一个值得死心塌地的人，好好爱。

sentences.english: Found south west chicken dont lose heart, treat the families of children with epilepsy.
sentences.chinese: 西凤不死心，找到了向南救治的癫痫患儿家属。

sentences.english: He wouldn’t stop until he reached the Yellow River—to give up until his hope has gone.
Only a handful of people were dead set on following him.
sentences.chinese: 死心塌地跟他走的只是一小撮。

sentences.english: Want to make a man fall head over heels in love with you?
sentences.chinese: 想让男人爱你爱到死心塌地？

sentences.english: Just so, if you create an authentic mindfulness of death.
sentences.chinese: 同样，若能生起真实的念死心。

sentences.english: Wait meeting, thief unwilling to give up, answer again, half body went in.
sentences.chinese: 等会儿，小偷不死心，又回，半个身体进去了。

definition: to be hell-bent on/dead set on sth/unswerving
to obstinately persist in going about things the wrong way (idiom)
change of affection, shift of love (idiom); to change one's feelings to another love/to fall in love with sb else
to be willing to/to resign oneself to
to sound out the difficulties and retreat to avoid defeat (idiom); fig. to back out of an awkward situation/to get out on finding out what it's really like
better to just get the pain over with, rather than prolong the agony
pinyin: chang2 tong4 bu4 ru2 duan3 tong4
